name: NuGet
help: The NuGet Command Line Interface (CLI) provides the full extent of NuGet functionality to install, create, publish, and manage packages.

properties.name: TargetPath
properties.help: Path of the package to push.

properties.name: ApiKey
properties.help: The API key for the target repository. If not present, the one specified in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.Config is used.

properties.name: Source
properties.help: Specifies the server URL. NuGet identifies a UNC or local folder source and simply copies the file there instead of pushing it using HTTP. Also, starting with NuGet 3.4.2, this is a mandatory parameter unless the NuGet.Config file specifies a DefaultPushSource value (see Configuring NuGet behavior).

properties.name: SymbolSource
properties.help: (3.5+) Specifies the symbol server URL; nuget.smbsrc.net is used when pushing to nuget.org

properties.name: SymbolApiKey
properties.help: (3.5+) Specifies the API key for the URL specified in -SymbolSource.

properties.name: NoSymbols
properties.help: (3.5+) If a symbols package exists, it will not be pushed to a symbol server.

properties.name: DisableBuffering
properties.help: Disables buffering when pushing to an HTTP(s) server to decrease memory usages. Caution: when this option is used, integrated Windows authentication might not work.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: The NuGet configuration file to apply. If not specified, %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.Config is used.

properties.name: Verbosity
properties.help: Specifies the amount of details displayed in the output: normal, quiet, detailed.

properties.name: ForceEnglishOutput
properties.help: (3.5+) Forces nuget.exe to run using an invariant, English-based culture.

properties.name: NonInteractive
properties.help: Suppresses prompts for user input or confirmations.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for pushing to a server. The default is 300 seconds (5 minutes).

properties.name: TargetPath
properties.help: The <c>.nuspec</c> or <c>.csproj</c> file.

properties.name: BasePath
properties.help: Sets the base path of the files defined in the <c>.nuspec</c> file.

properties.name: Build
properties.help: Specifies that the project should be built before building the package.

properties.name: Exclude
properties.help: Specifies one or more wildcard patterns to exclude when creating a package. To specify more than one pattern, repeat the <c>-Exclude</c> flag.

properties.name: ExcludeEmptyDirectories
properties.help: Prevent inclusion of empty directories when building the package.

properties.name: IncludeReferencedProjects
properties.help: Indicates that the built package should include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package. If a referenced project has a corresponding <c>.nuspec</c> file that has the same name as the project, then that referenced project is added as a dependency. Otherwise, the referenced project is added as part of the package.

properties.name: MinClientVersion
properties.help: Set the minClientVersion attribute for the created package. This value will override the value of the existing minClientVersion attribute (if any) in the .nuspec file.

properties.name: ForceEnglishOutput
properties.help: (3.5+) Forces nuget.exe to run using an invariant, English-based culture.

properties.name: MSBuildPath
properties.help: (4.0+) Specifies the path of MSBuild to use with the command, taking precedence over -MSBuildVersion.

properties.name: MSBuildVersion
properties.help: (3.2+) Specifies the version of MSBuild to be used with this command. Supported values are 4, 12, 14. By default the MSBuild in your path is picked, otherwise it defaults to the highest installed version of MSBuild.

properties.name: NoDefaultExcludes
properties.help: Prevents default exclusion of NuGet package files and files and folders starting with a dot, such as .svn and .gitignore.

properties.name: NoPackageAnalysis
properties.help: Specifies that pack should not run package analysis after building the package.

properties.name: OutputDirectory
properties.help: Specifies the folder in which the created package is stored. If no folder is specified, the current folder is used.

properties.name: Properties
properties.help: Specifies a list of properties that override values in the project file; see Common MSBuild Project Properties for property names. The Properties argument here is a list of token=value pairs, separated by semicolons, where each occurrence of $token$ in the .nuspec file will be replaced with the given value. Values can be strings in quotation marks. Note that for the "Configuration" property, the default is "Debug". To change to a Release configuration, use -Properties Configuration=Release.

properties.name: Suffix
properties.help: (3.4.4+) Appends a suffix to the internally generated version number, typically used for appending build or other pre-release identifiers. For example, using -suffix nightly will create a package with a version number like 1.2.3-nightly. Suffixes must start with a letter to avoid warnings, errors, and potential incompatibilities with different versions of NuGet and the NuGet Package Manager.

properties.name: Symbols
properties.help: Specifies that the package contains sources and symbols. When used with a <c>.nuspec</c> file, this creates a regular NuGet package file and the corresponding symbols package.

properties.name: Tool
properties.help: Specifies that the output files of the project should be placed in the <c>tool</c> folder.

properties.name: Verbosity
properties.help: Specifies the amount of details displayed in the output: normal, quiet, detailed.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Overrides the version number from the <c>.nuspec</c> file.

properties.name: TargetPath
properties.help: Defines the project to restore. I.e., the location of a solution file, a <c>packages.config</c>, or a <c>project.json</c> file.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: The NuGet configuration file to apply. If not specified, %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.Config is used.

properties.name: DirectDownload
properties.help: (4.0+) Downloads packages directly without populating caches with any binaries or metadata.

properties.name: DisableParallelProcessing
properties.help: Disables restoring multiple packages in parallel.

properties.name: FallbackSource
properties.help: (3.2+) A list of package sources to use as fallbacks in case the package isn't found in the primary or default source.

properties.name: ForceEnglishOutput
properties.help: (3.5+) Forces nuget.exe to run using an invariant, English-based culture.

properties.name: MSBuildPath
properties.help: (4.0+) Specifies the path of MSBuild to use with the command, taking precedence over -MSBuildVersion.

properties.name: MSBuildVersion
properties.help: (3.2+) Specifies the version of MSBuild to be used with this command. Supported values are 4, 12, 14, 15. By default the MSBuild in your path is picked, otherwise it defaults to the highest installed version of MSBuild.

properties.name: NoCache
properties.help: Prevents NuGet from using packages from local machine caches.

properties.name: NonInteractive
properties.help: Suppresses prompts for user input or confirmations.

properties.name: OutputDirectory
properties.help: Specifies the folder in which packages are installed. If no folder is specified, the current folder is used.

properties.name: PackageSaveMode
properties.help: Specifies the types of files to save after package installation: one of <c>nuspec</c>, <c>nupkg</c>, or <c>nuspec;nupkg</c>.

properties.name: PackagesDirectory
properties.help: Same as <c>OutputDirectory</c>.

properties.name: Project2ProjectTimeOut
properties.help: Timeout in seconds for resolving project-to-project references.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: (4.0+) Restores all references projects for UWP and .NET Core projects. Does not apply to projects using packages.config.

properties.name: RequireConsent
properties.help: Verifies that restoring packages is enabled before downloading and installing the packages. For details, see Package Restore.

properties.name: SolutionDirectory
properties.help: Specifies the solution folder. Not valid when restoring packages for a solution.

properties.name: Source
properties.help: Specifies the list of package sources (as URLs) to use for the restore. If omitted, the command uses the sources provided in configuration files, see Configuring NuGet behavior.

properties.name: Verbosity
properties.help: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output: normal, quiet, detailed.
